ext_descriptions.ext_description: A domain_context_type lists the types of the domain context.
specifies the "mechanical" domain context.
specifies the "thermal" domain context.
specifies the "electromechancial" domain context.
specifies the "electromagnetic compatibility" domain context.
specifies the "electrical" domain context.
A life_cycle_context_type lists the types of the life cycle context.
specifies that the life cycle context is "design".
specifies that the life cycle context is "qualify".
specifies that the life cycle context is "inspect".
specifies that the life cycle context is "test".
A material_conductivity_classification lists the classification types of the material conductivity.
specifies that material is conductive;
specifies that material is resistive;
specifies that material is semi conductive;
specifies that material is non conductive.
A requirement_view_relationship_type lists the operations of the relationship type.
specifies the "derived from" operation;
specifies the "precedence" operation;
specifies the "reference to" operation;
specifies the "supplemental" operation.
A relationship_operation lists the operations of the relationship.
specifies the "and" operation;
specifies the "or" operation.
An Inspection_requirement is a type of that specifies a production inspection related requirement. An Inspection_requirement may be a or a or a .

ext_description.p:
A Constraint_occurrence is a type of
that limits possible solutions to the requirements specification by identifying boundary conditions for any potential solution. A Constraint_occurrence may be a .

note.p: A constraint is simply a logical relation among several unknowns (or variables), each taking a value in a given domain. A constraint thus restricts the possible values that variables can take, it represents some partial information about the variables of interest. For instance, "the circle is inside the square" relates two objects without precisely specifying their positions, i.e., their coordinates. Now, one may move the square or the circle and he or she is still able to maintain the relation between these two objects. Also, one may want to add other object, say triangle, and introduce another constraint, say "square is to the left of the triangle". From the user (human) point of view, everything remains absolutely transparent.
Constraints naturally enjoy several interesting properties:

ul.li: constraints may specify partial information, i.e., constraint need not uniquely specify the values of its variables;
constraints are non-directional, typically a constraint on (say) two variables X, Y can be used to infer a constraint on X given a constraint on Y and vice versa;
constraints are declarative, i.e., they specify what relationship must hold without specifying a computational procedure to enforce that relationship;
constraints are additive, i.e., the order of imposition of constraints does not matter, all that matters at the end is that the conjunction of constraints is in effect;
constraints are rarely independent, typicaly constraints in the constraint store share variables.

note.p: Constraints arise naturally in most areas of human endeavor. The three angles of a triangle sum to 180 degrees, the sum of the currents floating into a node must equal zero, the position of the scroller in the window scrollbar must reflect the visible part of the underlying document, these are some examples of constraints which appear in the real world. Thus, constraints are a natural medium for people to express problems in many fields. Reference: http://kti.ms.mff.cuni.cz/~bartak/constraints/intro.html

ext_description.p:
A Design_characteristic_occurrence is a type of
that specifies the technical performance values and tolerances for some aspect of a design.
ext_description.note: The specifications set forth in design characteristics may include such items as enterprise or customer specifications on preferred packaging, power design and control, design rules, and preferred design practices.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A View_based_constraint_occurrence is a type of that has a basis in the characteristics of a . A View_based_constraint_occurrence may be a .
specifies the for the View_based_constraint_occurrence.

ext_description.p:
A Predefined_requirement_view_definition is a type of . A Predefined_requirement_view_definition may be either a
or a . A Predefined_requirement_view_definition is a statement of criteria for design or manufacturing that may be derived from more abstract criteria or may be a decomposition of a technical parameter associated wtih a product structure. Complex requirements may be associated with a product specifically for the purpose of managing the requirements.
ext_description.note: This part of ISO 10303 provides generic categories for enterprise classification of requirements and includes some predefined domain classified requirements.
ext_description.example: An inspection requirement may be derived from an electromagnetic requirement.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the for the Predefined_requirement_view_definition in a natural language. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Predefined_requirement_view_definition is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Predefined_requirement_view_definition as its . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the for the source of the Predefined_requirement_view_definition. There shall be one or more
for a Predefined_requirement_view_definition.

specifies a role of the
for the Predefined_requirement_view_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the for the Predefined_requirement_view_definition. There shall be one or more
for a Predefined_requirement_view_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the for the Predefined_requirement_view_definition. There shall be one or more for a Predefined_requirement_view_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
If required_material is provided, it's type shall be .
The of , that is in role of of Predefined_requirement_view_definition, shall be set to one of: 'mechanical', 'thermal', 'electromechancial', 'electromagnetic compatibility', 'electrical'.
The of , that is in role of of Predefined_requirement_view_definition, shall be set to one of: 'design', 'qualify', 'inspect', 'test'.

The
shall not be populated.
A Material_electrical_conductivity_requirement is a type of that specifies the requirement for conductive material.

ext_description.p:
specifies the
for the Material_electrical_conductivity_requirement. The electrical_conductivity_characteristic specifies either a
conductive, a non_conductive, a resistive, or a
semi_conductive classification of material conductivity for the .
ext_description.note: These are generic category names. If more specific data is required, the characteristics should be associated to the Material_electrical_conductivity_requirement using the inherited from .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Operational_requirement_relationship is a type of
and a type of . An Operational_requirement_relationship is the association between one
and another, with a defined type of relationship. An Operational_requirement_relationship is an incompletely modeled concept and shall be combined with members of
to form a complete requirement.
an instance specifies the first for the Operational_requirement_relationship. The first is the dependent item if the relationship is a dependency relationship.
an instance specifies the second for the Operational_requirement_relationship. The second is the independent item if the relationship is a dependency relationship.
specifies a result of the two operands after the operation. The result is of type .

ext_description.p:
The mathematical operations AND, OR shall be implemented for this relationship_type. The
AND_OPERATION is provided so that changes in relationship_type from
OR_OPERATION to
AND_OPERATION do not cause a structural change to the populated data. The implicit relationship between two member of that help to compose the same is an AND relationship.
The operand_1 shall not be the operand_2.

ext_description.note: This provides a mechanism to specify that one or more of the analysis or keepout shapes on is a constraint.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies a role of the for the Shape_and_view_based_constraint_occurrence. The interpretation shall be that the constraining_shape specifies the shape representation and the inherited from the supertype specifies the . There may be one or more for the Shape_and_view_based_constraint_occurrence.

The defined by the
must be a valid constraining shape.

The get_rvd function returns the set of Requirement_view_definitions that are assigned to the specified input by the Requirement_assignments, having their set to the specified id, as assigned_requirements.
